alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 4:54PM EDT until June 27 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL HUNTERDON...WEST CENTRAL MERCER...EAST CENTRAL MONTGOMERY...CENTRAL BUCKS AND NORTHEASTERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 454 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Gardenville to Richboro to Northeast Philadelphia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Bensalem, Ewing, Doylestown, Byram, New Hope, Yardley, Newtown, Dublin, Tullytown, Langhorne, Bryn Athyn, Ivyland, Stockton, Washington Crossing, Feasterville-Trevose, Northeast Philadelphia, Feasterville and Lumberville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 345 and 356. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey near mile marker 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
